Transcript: Harley: Do you think Jude's mom and dad went a little overboard?

Rick: We've got a swing, a fire truck, and 
more importantly, a basketball.
Harley: A basketball?

Rick: Yeah, the kid talked me into it. What 
can I say?
Harley: The kid wasn't even there.

Rick: Details, details. Hey, Coop. Got to 
practice up if you going to make the team. Come on. Want to see some dribbling. 
Want to see your moves.
Harley: Zach and Jude are sleeping, remember?

Rick: You just didn't make the team. All 
right, we'll play the blocks. They're quieter.
Harley: Okay.
Rick: All right.
Harley: Are you glad you came along?

Rick: All right, do you want to play with the 
blocks or do you want to play with the train?
Harley: You bought a train?
Rick: Yes.
Harley: What train?

Rick: Well, I bet you didn't know that I also 
happened to buy a cook book.
Harley: Oh. Would you look at this?
Rick: I do it all.

Harley: I mean, look at this. This is like 
instant family here. All the fun and lots of toys to play with, too. See, 
marriage might not be so bad after all, Rick. All you have to do is say yes.
Gus: What? What? What? What?

Babe:  you go after Danny even though he's 
probably gone straight. And to get to him, you cut a deal with Carmen even 
though we know that she's guilty. Why?

Gus: Look, Danny is as corrupt as they come, 
okay? He makes his mother look like Betty Crocker.
Babe: Funny. But I find that hard to believe.

Gus: Well, that's what makes him so 
dangerous. People don't believe that he's doing what he is doing.

Babe: Are you sure that this isn't personal 
like last time?
Gus: It isn't personal.

Babe: No, I mean it, Gus. People in the 
bureau are talking.

Gus: Well, then tell them do their job, get a 
hobby, whatever. Look, I said I would deliver Danny Santos, okay? I will-- and 
Carmen-- gift wrapped.

Babe: Rope, Aitoro. And then I hang you with 
it.
Catalina: Hey, buzz, there's no flirting with the customers, you know?

Buzz: I own the joint and it's a free 
country. What...

Holly: This from Mr. "Take back my sword 
fish, it taste funny, and where's the sparkling water I ordered?"

Buzz: The fish did taste funny and I was 
thirsty.

Holly: But how can you, as someone who own a 
restaurant, treat a waiter like that?
Buzz: You're talking about last night?

Holly: Yeah, as a matter fact I am. You 
treated that guy like nothing.

Buzz: Well, well, yeah, I did. I don't know 
why I did. No, I do know why I did. It's all your fault.
Holly: No, no, no

Buzz: Absolutely. Look, I always try, you 
know, when we're out to have things perfect. I'm too anxious about that. So I go 
overboard.

Holly: Yeah, you do. You know, I have an 
idea. I could do something that would help you to control yourself in public.
Buzz: To hold back.

Holly: Yes, let's say I did like... Like 
this.
Buzz: Uh-huh.
Holly: That means...
Buzz: That means get a grip on it.
Holly: Exactly.
Buzz: Okay.
Catalina: Hi, Tony.
Tony: Hi, yourself.

Buzz: Look at... Look at the way he's... I 
was just going to... Well, don't break it (laughs)

Richard: Coast Guard what do you mean he's 
not there? Find him and have him call me immediately. Where could he have taken 
her?

Dax: Richard, please, Alonzo may not be to 
blame for Cassie's, uh...

Richard: What? Disappearance? Abduction? Take 
your pick at this point. I think the words are interchangeable.

Dax: Perhaps it might be better if you took a 
bit of a rest.
Richard: I'm fine.
Dixie: You've been up all night.

Richard: Do you actually think I could sleep 
not knowing Cassie's whereabouts? How could she just wander off with someone 
like that?
Dax: Richard, Alonzo's a friend.

Richard:  A friend. Why do you keep on 
persisting on defending the man? Walton thinks he's nothing short of a sexual 
predator. Don't you think it's a little bit odd that she just vanished, 
disappeared without a word. Oh, wait a minute. There was a word. "I'm fine. 
Don't worry." Don't worry, Dax, I'm very worried! Damned worried!

Dax: If it were a true kidnapping we would 
have been contacted about a ransom by now.
Richard: Maybe and maybe not.

Dax: Richard, after what Cassie suffered 
under Edmund's hands, it's understandable for you to be more protective than 
ever. But what exactly is it that concerns you about Alonzo? Do feel that he has 
designs on Cassie? (Phone ringing) or that he might tell her about the papers 
you had him sign relinquishing him from claim on young Will?

Richard: well where you? Never mind that. How 
soon can you have the "Gristede" refueled? Five hours. I don't have five hours! 
I don't have five minutes, Dax. Have the helicopter brought into the launching 
pad in the courtyard. I'll fly the bloody thing myself, but Cassie will be 
found.
Cassie: Alonzo? Alonzo? Great, don't tell me he left me.
Alonzo: You called?
Cassie: Yeah.

Alonzo: Morning. I know coffee would have 
been better, but that's all I can find on the boat.

Cassie: Oh, a girl could get use to service 
like this.

Alonzo: swimming back to the main island as 
soon as the tide turns. I hope it does it soon, though, too. The quicker we get 
you back to your husband the better.

Cassie: Poor Richard. You know, I know he 
didn't sleep a wink last night. I wish I could have got in touch with him.

Alonzo: Pretty tough to do with the radio 
smashed and your cell phone awol.

Cassie: I know. I'm going to have that cell 
phone welded to my wrist.

Alonzo: You know what? El presidente has 
probably got me pegged as a wife snatcher right now.

Cassie: What? That's in your head, not his. 
If anything he's going to worry less because he knows that I'm with you. Because 
he trusts you.
Alonzo: Don't be so sure about that.

Rick: Harley, you can't assemble a marriage together like a bunch of building 
blocks.

Harley: Well, why not? If we have all the 
pieces, why not?

Rick: That's just it. We don't have all the 
pieces.

Harley: Well, hey, it's better than an 
arranged marriage, right? At least you know what's underneath my veil.
(Laughs)
Rick: Uh, check, please.

Harley: And we like each other, and we get 
along really well, and we have fun together.
Rick: What are you doing? Stop this.
Harley: (Laughs)

Rick: So there've fun and we made a great 
baby together. But there's some details missing that concern me like... Like the 
marriage part.

Harley: Yeah. No, I understand, because 
remember that concerned me, too, before, back when I turned you down the first 
time.
Rick: Yeah, I remember that.

Harley: But things change, Rick. And now, I 
don't see a reason why we shouldn't tie the knot.

Rick: What kind of knot were you thinking 
about?

Harley: No, no. See, I know what you're 
doing. You can hem and haw your way through this thing from here to eternity. If 
I don't give you a deadline... I'm giving you a deadline whether you want it 
now.
Rick: deadline?

Harley: You're getting a deadline. I am 
going, and I'm going to take these new baby pictures down to my dad, and when I 
get back I expect the answer from you that I've been looking for.

Rick: Oh, this is just what I need, another 
woman telling me what to do.
Harley: You love it.

Rick: I expect to be courted. I don't want to 
rush into things. I like to take my time.

Harley: (Laughs) Good, well, I'll bring you 
back a heart-shaped box of candy, okay.

Rick: All right, thank you. Listen, so I look 
that easy? A box a candy... You think that's all it's going to take for me? The 
deal is when you come back, I'll make up my mind. That's the deal.

Harley: I knew you'd see it my way. Bye, 
snookums.

Rick: Snookums? She's going to have to come 
up with a better name than snookums. I wish there was a recipe on how to have a 
happy family.

Tory: Here. In "Hagner vs. Mishler," the court was urged to hold that the 
legality of a search...

Ross: No, no, no. That's a garbage can case, 
all right? Would you keep looking? I'm going to say hello to my wife. Well, hey, 
Jeff, how are you doing?

Jeff: Glad to see you're not always in the 
law library.
Tory: Not always.
Ross: I don't even get a hello anymore?
Blake: Well, you look busy.

Ross: I'm never to busy for you or for my 
Buzz. (Laughs)
Buzz: (Mumbling)

Ross: How's Harley and the baby doing? Does 
Zach like his little brother?

Buzz: Oh, Rick's taking good care them, the 
group.
Ross: Rick's a good man.

Buzz: Yeah, he's finally somebody he can 
count on I think.
Holly: Cute.

Blake: I wouldn't throw him out of the house. 
You know what I mean. Mmm.
Holly: Mmm.
Blake: This could be promising.

Tory: It sounds nice, but I really don't have 
time for a movie.

Jeff: You're not holding out for someone else 
are you?

Tory: Who would I possibly be holding out 
for? Oh, don't be ridiculous. He's my boss.
Catalina: Tony, people are watching.
Tony: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Let them.

Catalina: Um, I better take your order. What 
would you like?
Tony: For now you can give me a club soda.
Buzz: No flirting with the customers.
Catalina: I'll get your drink.

Tony: Yeah, hurry back. Uh, Romeo, it's Tony. 
Listen, the second you get this, you call me, all right. I need to know if Sam's 
bought that ticket to get out of town yet.
Babe: Time is running out..

Gus: Look, don't. Please, I am delivering the 
kingpins of organized crime. I have to do it one at a time. You're acting as if 
I am chasing after some penny-ante drug pushers, and I resent that. I resent it. 
I am putting my life on the line.

Babe: Okay. I want a legit case, you got 
that? No funny business. And if I hear that this is some sort of personal 
vendetta...
Gus: You’ll get what you want. Okay

Babe: Oh, I know I'm going to get what I 
want. The question is, is if you're the man who's going to give it to me.

Gus: Look, I'll tell you this one more time. 
I will deliver Danny Santos. I give you my word.

Babe: I don't want your word, Gus. I want 
results.
Alonzo: People like your husband don't automatically trust people like me.

Cassie: Nothing like a big fat generalization 
before breakfast.
Alonzo: I know what I'm talking about.

Cassie: Well, you know what? This time, 
you're wrong, because no one knows Richard Winslow better than this 
working-class girl. And he's not paranoid. If anything he's the opposite, you 
know. He's willing to give people the benefit of the doubt all the time.
Alonzo: He thinks I’m a loose cannon.

Cassie: No, he doesn't. He thinks you're a 
free spirit, and that is not a judgment, Alonzo, it's an observation because you 
are a free spirit. But you also have integrity, and Richard knows that and I 
know that. How do we know that? We know that because you proved it to us.
Alonzo: Right. It's so well documented.
Cassie: Is that an airplane?

Alonzo: I don't know. Sounds more like a 
helicopter. Doesn't sound like it's stopping though.

Cassie: You know, you should learn to take a 
compliment.

Alonzo: I don't need people putting me on a 
pedestal, especially not the president's wife.

Cassie: Do we have a problem with our taste 
in heroes?
Alonzo:  that's not very heroic.

Cassie: I'm serious, Alonzo. Why do you have 
such a hard time seeing yourself as an honorable man? That's how I see you. And 
to tell you the truth, that's why I was so surprised that you gave up Will so 
easily.
Tory: Look, I really have to get back to work.

Jeff: Well, how about if we have dinner 
sometime?
Tory: Jeff, thank you, but I can't.
Jeff: (Sighs) well, it's your loss.
Blake: Friend of yours?
Tory: He's been in a few of my classes.

Blake: He's pretty cute. Seems like he liked 
you.

Tory: I'm still not over my husband yet. And 
besides, I wouldn't go out with just anyone that comes along.

Ross: Tory, I think you will know when you 
are ready to date again.

Blake: Sure, and then you'll be ready for 
cute boys like that.
Ross: So you think Jeff is cute, huh?
Blake: Sure, as younger boys go. (Laughs)

Ross: Right answer, yes. Tory, do you have 
time this afternoon to go over "Murphy vs. Fraser"?
Tory: Of course.
Ross: Great.
Tory: And actually, I made some notes on it.

Ross: Good, good. I'll join you, but I have 
to file a deposition first and I'll see you both at home.
Blake: Oh.
Ross: Bye, beautiful.

Blake: So I really did think he was cute. (
Laughter) you sure you're not interested?

Tory: He’s nice just not really my type, you 
know.
Blake: Yeah? What is your type?

Tory: Well, I like someone a little more 
worldly wise, you know.
Blake: Mmm, so do I.

Tory: Yeah, you know, a man who is 
intelligent, who appreciates intelligence in a woman, who's not intimidated by 
that, you know. I guess someone like Stuart. So if I never get married again, 
it's a okay. As long as I graduate and pass the bar, I'll have my work.

Blake: You know, it's not impossible to find 
a man like that. I did. But if you want to score, you have to have the right 
ammunition.
Tory: Ammunition?

Blake: The way you dress and carry yourself-- 
well, it doesn't exactly scream "available." If you used what you have, you'd be 
surprised. I mean, you would meet men that you never knew existed.

Tory: Besides, I'm not... I'm not glamorous 
like you are. You know, I know who I am and I accept that.

Blake: Do you? Have you ever looked in a 
mirror?
Tory: I know what I look like.

Blake: Have you... I mean, you have these 
eyes and these cheek bones and the skin. You know, have the exact same coloring 
as Ross's daughter, Dinah. Same age, too. And she managed to turn herself into a 
looker. If she can do it, you could do it. Have you ever had a makeover?
Tory: No! And I don't want one.
Blake: Why not?
Tory: Because it's not me.

Gus: Carmen, pick up, pick up. All right, look, when you get this message you 
got to call me, because if we don't talk soon, this thing is going to blow up in 
our face.
Harley: These are good.
Buzz: Yeah.
Holly: Oh, look. Oh, I love them at this age.
Buzz: Yeah, they can't talk back.
Holly: Oh, he's so cute.

Harley: Is that directed at me? How would you 
know?
Gus: Oh, there's... There's my boy.
Buzz: Your boy?
Gus: Can I have one of those, you think?
Harley: No, you may not.

Gus: I just need a small one for wallet. Come 
on, I birthed the kid. Aren't I considered like a godfather to him?

Buzz: Touch one of these and I’ll knock your 
block off.

Gus: You know what, buzz? Forget it, all 
right.
Buzz: All right.
Gus: So... How is he?

Harley: He is in the care of his father at 
our house.
Gus: Our house?

Harley: Our house. Or at least it will be our 
house once Rick settles in.
Gus: Wow.
Rick: Hey, Mel...
Mel: Hey.
Rick: What a great surprise.

Mel: I am so sorry to bother you. I know 
you're on leave, but this just couldn't wait.
Rick: No, please, come on in. What's up?

Mel: Um, it's Mr. Sanderson. I tried paging 
you for hours, and then finally I went to your house and your aunt Meta gave me this.
Rick: I’ve got five messages on here.

Mel: All from me. So your aunt said that 
Harley's moving back home. Is it true?

Rick: Um, well, as you could see she's... 
Look, um, I was just in the kitchen. Can I get you some cookies?
Mel: Are you moving in, too?

Cassie: I just don't understand how someone can give up their child so easily 
without a fuss. To me it's the most amazing powerful bond there is.

Alonzo: And if I don't feel it, I'm a 
monster, is that it?

Cassie: No. No, I just think you're missing 
something. I remember the first time Tammy saw the ocean. I took her to a beach 
in Texas. And when she heard the sound of the surf she sat straight up on her 
blanket and she looked towards the sound. And she got up on those fat little 
baby legs of hers and she started running towards the water. I could barely keep 
up with her. And then when the water washed over her toes, she looked up at me 
with such delight like she had found a new best friend.

Alonzo: Maybe she'll end up on a fishing 
boat.

Cassie: Well, she could do worse. Yeah, I'm 
just telling you this because, you know, Will, he's already in my heart, just 
like Tammy and R.J., And I just... I just think that's something you should 
experience.

Alonzo: Is that why you keep trying to find 
things for me to do around the palace, so I can be close to Will, maybe get the 
whole heart buzz thing?
Cassie: Is that so terrible of me?

Alonzo: No. It's just beyond my 
comprehension.
Cassie: Why?

Alonzo: Because you really don't know me at 
all. So how come you care so much about how I feel?

Cassie: Because you're the father of my son. 
And you... You changed my life by trusting us with him, and no one has given me 
such special gift before. And thank you. I just thank you. Thank you so much.
Cassie: Oh, my God, thank God!
Richard: Are you all right?

Cassie: Now I am. Oh, I'm so glad you're 
here.
Alonzo: Is that your helicopter we heard?

Richard: Yeah, we sat down on the other side 
of the island.

Cassie: I'd like to say that I knew you'd 
come rescue me, but I didn't know.

Richard: Thanks for your vote of confidence. 
And I wish I could say why you needed to be rescued.
Alonzo: The engine on my trawler gave out.

Cassie: And the electrical system toasted 
itself.

Richard: Well, that explains the loss of the 
transponder signal and I guess this explains the loss of your communications.

Cassie: And I left my cell phone on San 
Cristobel.
Richard: Dax found it at the rusty anchor.

Alonzo: The wind, it just blew the boat right 
up under the sand bar. We ended up on the side of it.

Cassie: Not such a bad place. You know, it 
does have fruits and vegetables, but it also has poisonous snakes, and Alonzo, 
thank god, saved me from one.

Richard: Well, it sounds like quite the 
adventure.

Cassie: I just want to get home and take a 
hot shower.

Richard: That's what you're going to get when 
you get back to San Cristobel.

Cassie: Hey, I'm sorry. I'm so sorry. You 
know, I know after everything that happened with Edmund keeping me away from 
weeks, you must have been terrified. I can't imagine what was going through your 
head.
Richard: Well, there's quite a lot going through my head, not the least of
which was the fact that you might have been kidnapped.

Rick: Actually, you know, I'm just hanging out and babysitting, you know, while 
Harley's still in town.
Mel: Harley likes jazz?

Rick: That's my cd, actually. Is this the 
Sanderson x-ray?

Mel: Yeah. You take a quick look, I'll be out 
of your way.

Rick: You're not in my way. As matter of 
fact, I've missed you.
Mel: Yeah?

Rick: Yes. Well, you know, I mean, I miss 
hanging out with you. I miss arguing with you. All the above. I mean, I guess 
you can see by looking around this room my life has changed. No more spur of the 
moment movie dates, that's for sure.
Mel: Rent a video.
Rick:  It's not the same thing.

Mel: No, I guess not. So do you want to take 
a look?
Rick: Yeah, sure. Excuse me.
Mel: Okay.

Rick: I'll grab this light here. Okay, let's 
see what we got here. All right, what's the story here? Has he been on chemo for 
two or is it three weeks?
Mel: 23 days. Do you see what I see?

Rick: It's a nice call, Mel. You're turning 
out to be quite the doctor.
Mel: Thank you, doctor.

Rick: Must be nice around the hospital these 
days-- no one looking over your shoulder, questioning every single move.
Mel: I like having you look over my shoulder.

Tony: Just tell me that Sam has left town. That's all I want to hear. What do 
you mean you don't know where he is? I told you to keep an eye on him. The kid's 
a moving target. If Carlos finds out where he is he's... Forget it. You know, 
the rumor is that you're leaving town, Spencer?

Sam: Don't believe everything you hear, 
Santos.

Gus: So when did you decide all of this? Wait. I bet I know what it is... Was. 
Was it the night that I asked about the night that we almost kissed? Yeah, I bet 
it was. I made you all nervous. You go running to Rick for comfort, right? All 
right, all right, all right, all right. Sit, please? We don't have to talk about 
it, ever. Ever again. Look, Harley, I am just a hardworking private investigator 
now, okay, and all I'm... What I'm.... All I'm looking for in you is friendship. 
That's all...

Harley: Would you cut the bull, please. The 
big-time FBI man hangs out a shingle in Springfield? I don't think so.

Gus: There's nothing for me in Washington 
anymore.

Harley: Okay, but why here? I mean, you left 
Springfield. You were gone and now you're back setting up this rinky-dinky 
little pi office. Why? Are you back to nail Danny?

Gus: Can you just stop the talking like a 
damn cop for five minutes?

Harley: Maybe because I am a damn cop, which 
is why I think it's strange that Carmen is-- well, alive-- but walking around 
scot-free.

Gus: I don't know. She must have cut a deal. 
Isn't that how they got Machado?

Harley: See, if you still worked for the FBI, 
I'd think it was you, because this sounds like something that twisted, unlawful 
little mind would come up with, you know.
Gus: Is that right?
Harley: Yeah.

Gus: You know what, Coop? I think you've been 
watching too many "Magnum" reruns.

Harley: Well, then it's good for Danny and 
the American way that you can't abuse that kind of power anymore, right?
Gus: Yeah. Yes, it is, isn't it. I guess so.

Harley: If you honestly think that I think 
you've been defanged and declawed, I don't. If you honestly think that I think 
you're walking the straight and narrow...

Gus: Coop, let me tell you something. Do 
yourself a favor and never confuse my kindness for weakness, okay.
Harley: Oh, I don't.
Ross: Closing the following adjustments shall be made for...

Blake:I know you two are busy but I thought 
might like a break.

Ross: Oh, yes. Yes, you are so right. Would 
somebody please talk to me about something other than "Murphy vs. Fraser."
Blake: Okay, how about costumes?
Ross: Why?

Blake: Phillip is throwing a Beth a party, a 
costume party.
Ross: Oh.

Blake: So what do you say? Take your little 
Dracula costume out of storage?

Tory: I can't believe you are going to wear a 
costume.
Ross: Why not?
Tory: Well, because you're just so...
Ross: What?

Blake: Dignified? Refined? One year he went 
as the blob.
Tory (laughs)

Ross: I was good as a blob. Oh, listen. 
Listen here. We could start at the very beginning and we could be Adam and eve?

Blake: Allergic to fig leaves. Mm-mm. Fred 
and Ethel?

Ross: No, Blake, you are beautiful and 
glamorous. Now, let's see it from that angle and come up with you being a beauty 
from history.
Blake: And then what will you be?
Ross: What else? Your slave.
Blake: Oh. (Laughs)

Tony: I heard through the grapevine that you're planning on going to Harvard. 
You ask me, that's a smart move.

Sam: That job opportunity is still open, I 
would like to take you up on it.

Holly: The offer still stands and I am very 
happy about it. Harvard's loss is our gain.
Buzz: My sentiments exactly.
Tony: No, that's stupid. Really stupid.

Gus: I'm just saying that I miss our fights, you know, and our battles and our 
battle of the wits, our debates and our difference with legal ideals.

Harley: You have no ideals. I should be 
getting home to Rick.

Gus: Right, go to Rick. I'm just going to ask 
you one last thing.
Harley: Okay.

Gus: What's next? Wedding bells? Or is Rick 
being as cautious as usual and taking his sweet time?

Harley: If Rick was always so cautious, I 
wouldn't have baby Jude now, would I?
Gus: (sighs) ...Woman.
Mel: What are you cooking?

Rick: What am I cooking? Well, not what I 
intended. I can't make what I'm making because I don't have the ingredients to 
make it.
Mel: So improvise.
Rick: Improvise?
Mel: Yeah.

Rick: That's nice advice. Improvise. The only 
problem is it's kind of hard to make meatloaf without the meat.

Mel: Unless you're making veggie loaf. Ever 
heard of that? Be creative. That's what cooking is all about: Imagination, 
improvisation, surprise.

Rick: Celery and carrots instead of 
hamburger?

Mel: Why not? Too risky? I'm surprised you're 
so hesitant.

Rick: Maybe I’m getting cautious in my old 
age.
Mel: You're not old.

Rick: See that? That is the perfect looking 
meatloaf.

Mel: Who cares what it look like. How about 
how it tastes?
Rick: I'm sure it's going to taste great.
Mel: Well, you never know until you try.
Rick: You think?
Mel: I know. (Phone rings)
Rick: I'm sorry.
Mel: No, don't be.

Rick: It was the picture of the meatloaf that 
got me carried away.

Harley (answering machine): We're not in. 
You know what to do. Rick? It's Harley, I'm on my way to believe it or not...

Mel: No. You know what? It's not going to 
work.
Harley: I'll be home in 30, 40 minutes.
Rick: We can just... Don't say that.
Mel: Let's just forget it ever happened.
Rick: Mel, wait a minute.
Cassie: Kidnapped? Why would you think that I was kidnapped?

Richard: Well, I'm not exactly going to rule 
that out, am I? It wouldn't have been the first time.

Cassie: I just wanted to know what the people 
thought about the Coastal Commission proposal, and Alonzo said that I had to go 
to the people. And not as the first lady, but as a concerned citizen. So that's 
what I was trying to do.

Richard: And these people were reachable only 
by fishing trawler, were they?
Alonzo: It's the fastest way to get there.
Richard: Oh.

Alonzo: Normally. Look, I'm sorry about all 
of this.

Cassie: I still don't understand why you 
thought I was kidnapped. I told my security officer to tell you that I was with 
Alonzo.

Richard: Let's just say I had some other 
information that was a little bit disturbing.
Cassie: From who?

Richard: The same fellow who was so upset 
yesterday at the rusty anchor.
Alonzo: Walton?

Richard: It seems Walton was rather convinced 
that you had either forced my wife or the very least lured her onto your boat.
Cassie: For what?
Alonzo: To have my way with you.
Cassie: What?
Richard: Walton claims that Alonzo here seduced his wife and destroyed
his marriage.
Alonzo: It's a lie.

Cassie: Well, I want to... You didn't believe 
this, did you?
Richard: Thank God you're safe.
Ross: I've got it. You can go as Lady Godiva.
Blake: Naked on a horse eating chocolates?

Ross: Nudity and chocolates. What's not to 
like? Okay, we don't have to do that. We can go classical and you can be 
Cleopatra, or better yet, you can be Helen of Troy. Or we can jump forward and 
we can be modern and you could be Elizabeth Taylor or a red-headed Marilyn 
Monroe.
Blake: you’re getting carried away.

Ross: No, I'm not. To me you are all those 
people, different nights, different women.
Blake: Honey...
Ross: Hmm?
Blake: I think you're embarrassing Tory.
Tory: No, no, he's not.

Blake: Why don't we go upstairs and find out 
what we've got. Will you mind taking those boxes out of storage?
Ross: It's not easy being a slave.
Blake: Thanks.
Ross: I'll be right back.

Tory: Blake, you know all this talk about 
costumes and transforming into someone else...

Blake: Oh, no problem. I can whip you up a 
costume.

Tory: No, no, that's not what I mean. I think 
I want that makeover you said you'd give me.
Harley: You certainly got comfortable while I was gone.

Rick: Well, you know, I'm just making myself 
at home.
Harley: Mmm. Is dinner ready?

Rick: No, not yet. Actually, coq au vin takes 
a little while to prepare.
Harley: Coq au vin?
Rick: Yeah.
Harley: Well, it sounds very romantic.

Rick: Well, I only make that for special 
occasions, actually.
Harley: Special occasion?
Rick: Mm-hmm.

Harley: Does this mean that you're going to 
say yes?

Rick: Well, hold on, hold on here, Lucy. Hold 
on. I just... Actually I have a proposal of my own.
Harley: Uh-huh.

Rick: maybe there’s a middle road here, 
Harley, that we haven't explored yet, something that we haven't even thought 
about.
Harley: Like?

Rick: Like... Like a different way of looking 
at family. Harley, I want to move in with you and give our son full-time daddy, 
and perhaps maybe even help you in the kitchen every now and then. What do you 
think?
Harley: I think that sounds great.

Rick: And then we'll just see what happens 
next.
Harley: Deal.
Rick: Deal. (Laughter)
Harley: Well, shall we have a toast?
Rick: Yes, yes, we shall. Here you go.
Rick: All right.

Harley: To wherever it is we're going 
together.
